concept.title: Audio chatting on your Apple device
concept.shortdesc: You can initiate an audio chat with someone in your contact list on HCL Connections Chat by using your Apple device.

conbody.p: To begin an audio chat with someone in your contacts list, press the audio chat icon on their person card. The recipient can either accept or decline the notification.

To initiate an audio chat by using something other than your default calling method, open the Information tab of the contact's person card. Select one of the phone numbers listed in this view. A menu opens with the calling options that are available to you. Tap the dialing option to use.
conbody.note: If only one dialing option is available, the call starts with that option.

conbody.p: After an audio chat begins, you and your chat partner hears each other speaking through your devices. The following options are available during an audio chat:

row.entry: Temporarily mutes your audio on the call.
Open the device's keypad for entering information.

concept.title: Working with the Audio Chat tab

conbody.p: The Audio Chat tab on the left menu displays two panes of information.

The first pane is a list of recent audio chats, with the most recent listed at the top. The list indicates with icons whether you initiated an audio chat, received a notification, declined a notification, or if you missed calls. Tapping on any of the items displays the person card of the chat partner.
The second pane contains the dialing keypad. You can use the keypad to directly dial a number by using Connections Chat or a third-party dialer.
